Hello,

I'm in the process of implementing hyper-Neat for=C2=A0time series =
prediction=C2=A0applied 
to forex. Is there=C2=A0a simple way to adapted hy=
per-Neat adapt for 
real-time=C2=A0predictions very similar to rtNeat?=C2=
=A0 Would I have to 
change=C2=A0the=C2=A0HyperNEAT engine completely =C2=
=A0?

Thanks

Peter =C2=A0




________________________________
From: Peter=
 Henry <blackprinzze@...>
To: neat@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sun, 7 Nov=
ember, 2010 5:25:00
Subject: Re: [neat] Re: Financial trading with Hypernea=
t


Daniel,

The markets are always changing so I need something that is ev=
olutionary, 
changes as the markets change. So some kind of loop back infor=
mation is required 
from the market environment. The issue I have it that f=
orecast would be correct 
for few bars then Neural network would have to be=
 retrained. I have more success 
just optimising data periodically using a =
GA than neural networks, I believe 
both fused together with some kind of r=
e reinforced learning would have benefit.

Thanks I ll have a look to see w=
hat I can find. 

Peter 




________________________________
From: Daniel =
Tuohy <danielr2e@...>
To: neat@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sun, 7 November,=
 2010 4:19:18
Subject: Re: [neat] Re: Financial trading with Hyperneat

=C2=
=A0 
Peter,

What you want is a machine learning algorithm. =C2=A0The many =
flavors of NEAT are 
indeed such algorithms, but NEAT is fairly exotic. My =
advice is to have a go 
with WEKA. =C2=A0WEKA will provide you with lots of=
 different machine learning 
algorithms (including neural networks), and it=
 should be pretty easy for you to 
figure out how to set up an experiment w=
ith your data. =C2=A0It will very well 
documented, and is likely to be eas=
ier to use for an ML novice than any NEAT 
distribution, Hyper or otherwise=
 (although I cannot speak from experience, so I 
am perfectly willing to be=
 corrected on this point).

Two words of warning:

(1) Make sure you unders=
tand what it means to maintain a test set distinct from 
the training data.=
 =C2=A0Just because you have a model that fits the data well does 
not mean=
 your model has learned anything interesting (i.e. anything other than 
noi=
se). =C2=A0If it predicts well with an unseen test set, then you've got som=
ething.
(2) If you find yourself needing advice from the Weka community, yo=
u might want 
to keep the nature of your data to yourself. =C2=A0You are li=
kely to receive the same 
reception.=C2=A0

Good luck, and I encourage you =
to keep an open mind if you should find your 
models unable to predict anyt=
hing of interest. =C2=A0And if that should be the case, 
you will at least =
have had some useful experience with ML and Weka that could 
serve you well=
 with future financial experiments.

Daniel

>
>
>Have =
a look at this paper its from the Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta, has a 
>=
brief abstract at the beginning that explains external influences. 
>
>
>Mo=
re close to home, is inter-market influences. Correlation between markets c=
an=C2=A0 
>also be used to aid prediction in target market. 
>
>
>Please do=
n't start a debate on this one!! .. I would like to simply use the 
>close =
prices of the relevant inter-market data to forecast next period close 
>pr=
ices or simply whether there is going to be an up close or down for the nex=
t 
>period. 
>
>
>The main reason why I'm interested in this group is becau=
se the NEAT algorithm 
>provides feedback from current market environment (=
Correct me if I'm wrong) 
>which in my view is critical.
>
>Hope you guys c=
ould be of help to point me in the right direction.

>Thanks

>Peter

That is, if enough people believe in a system and

<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>I'm in the process of imple=
menting hyper-Neat for time series prediction applied to forex. I=
s there a simple way to adapted hyper-Neat adapt for real-time pr=
edictions very similar to rtNeat?  Would I have to change the&nbs=
p;HyperNEAT engine completely  ?</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>Thanks</=
DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>Peter  <BR></DIV>
<DIV style=3D"FONT-FAMIL=
Y: tahoma, new york, times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><BR>
<DIV style=3D"BORD=
ER-LEFT: #1010ff 2px solid; MARGIN: 5px 0px 5px 5px; PADDING-LEFT: 5px; FON=

<B><SPAN style=3D"FONT-WEIGHT: bold">F=
rom:</SPAN></B> Peter Henry <blackprinzze@...><BR><B><SPAN st=
yle=3D"FONT-WEIGHT: bold">To:</SPAN></B> neat@yahoogroups.com<BR><B><SPAN s=
tyle=3D"FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Sent:</SPAN></B> Sun, 7 November, 2010 5:25:00<B=
R><B><SPAN style=3D"FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Subject:</SPAN></B> Re: [neat] Re: F=
inancial trading with Hyperneat<BR></FONT><BR>
<DIV style=3D"FONT-FAMILY: t=
ahoma, new york, times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">
<DIV>Daniel,<BR><BR>The ma=
rkets are always changing so I need something that is evolutionary, changes=
 as the markets change. So some kind of loop back information is required f=
rom the market environment. The issue I have it that forecast would be corr=
ect for few bars then Neural network would have to be retrained. I have mor=
e success just optimising data periodically using a GA than neural networks=
, I believe both fused together with some kind of re reinforced learning wo=
uld have benefit.<BR><BR>Thanks I ll have a look to see what I can find. <B=
R><BR>Peter <BR></DIV>
<DIV style=3D"FONT-FAMILY: tahoma, new york, times, =
serif; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><BR>
<DIV style=3D"BORDER-LEFT: rgb(16,16,255) 2px =
solid; MARGIN: 5px 0px 5px 5px; PADDING-LEFT: 5px; FONT-FAMILY: times new r=
oman, new york, times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><FONT size=3D2 face=3DTahoma=
>
<HR SIZE=3D1>
<B><SPAN style=3D"FONT-WEIGHT: bold">From:</SPAN></B> Danie=
l Tuohy <danielr2e@...><BR><B><SPAN style=3D"FONT-WEIGHT: bold"=
>To:</SPAN></B> neat@yahoogroups.com<BR><B><SPAN style=3D"FONT-WEIGHT: bold=
">Sent:</SPAN></B> Sun, 7 November, 2010 4:19:18<BR><B><SPAN style=3D"FONT-=
WEIGHT: bold">Subject:</SPAN></B> Re: [neat] Re: Financial trading with Hyp=
erneat<BR></FONT><BR><SPAN style=3D"DISPLAY: none"> </SPAN> 
<DIV id=
=3Dygrp-text>
<P>Peter,</P>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>What you want is a machine=
 learning algorithm.  The many flavors of NEAT are indeed such algorit=
hms, but NEAT is fairly exotic. My advice is to have a go with <A href=3D"h=
ttp://www.cs.waikato.ac.nz/ml/weka/" rel=3Dnofollow target=3D_blank>WEKA</A=
>.  WEKA will provide you with lots of different machine learning algo=
rithms (including neural networks), and it should be pretty easy for you to=
 figure out how to set up an experiment with your data.  It will very =
well documented, and is likely to be easier to use for an ML novice than an=
y NEAT distribution, Hyper or otherwise (although I cannot speak from exper=
ience, so I am perfectly willing to be corrected on this point).</DIV>
<DIV=
><BR></DIV>
<DIV>Two words of warning:</DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>(1) Make =
sure you understand what it means to maintain a test set distinct from the =
training data.  Just because you have a model that fits the data well =
does not mean your model has learned anything interesting (i.e. anything ot=
her than noise).  If it predicts well with an unseen test set, then yo=
u've got something.</DIV>
<DIV>(2) If you find yourself needing advice from=
 the Weka community, you might want to keep the nature of your data to your=
self.  You are likely to receive the same reception. </DIV>
<DIV>=
<BR></DIV>
<DIV>Good luck, and I encourage you to keep an open mind if you =
should find your models unable to predict anything of interest.  And i=
f that should be the case, you will at least have had some useful experienc=
e with ML and Weka that could serve you well with future financial experime=
nts.</DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>Daniel</DIV>
<DIV><BR><BR>
<DIV class=3Dgma=
il_quote>On Sun, Nov 7, 2010 at 12:00 AM, Peter Henry <SPAN dir=3Dltr><<=
A href=3D"mailto:blackprinzze@..." rel=3Dnofollow target=3D_blank y=

</SPAN> wrote:<BR>

olid" class=3Dgmail_quote>
<DIV style=3D"BACKGROUND-COLOR: rgb(255,255,255)=

<DIV>
<DIV>

<DIV>Hi All, <BR><BR>This debate can go on fo=

>More close to home, is inter-market influences. Correlation between market=
s can  also be used to aid prediction in target market. <BR><BR>Please=
 don't start a debate on this one!! .. I would like to simply use the close=
 prices of the relevant inter-market data to forecast next period close pri=
ces or simply whether there is going to be an up close or down for the next=
 period. <BR><BR>The main reason why I'm interested in this group is becaus=
e the NEAT algorithm provides feedback from current market environment (Cor=
rect me if I'm wrong) which in my view is critical.<BR><BR>Hope you guys co=
uld be of help to point
 me in the right direction. <BR><BR>Thanks <BR><BR>=
Peter <BR><BR>Millionaires do not use astrology, billionaires do". -J.P. Mo=
rgan<BR><BR><BR></DIV>

<P>Hi all, <BR><BR>I don't think this planetar=
